page.title: 07CLUBS AND SOCIETIES
page.content: The clubs in Winterton are very popular. There are over 20. Some of the members have to wear uniforms and badges. 16 of the clubs are for younger people. Many activities go on such as competitions, trips, raising money for charities etc. In our village there are; brownies, guides, scouts, Womens' Institute, buffs, bingo, woodcraft and many more. The brownies were formed in 1910. They have 24 members. A brownie's job is to help people. We sent a letter to all the clubs in Winterton. 8 replied. The clubs mostly meet at pubs and schools or sometimes they have their own special place to meet. The buffs is a club for adults who raise money for charities. They started in 1950. The mothers' club has the most members, 52. The guides have the smallest club, 22. The React club is for CB listeners
